/.desc: Mount point for the boot loader files
/.note: Usually its read-only unless the boot loader or the kernel are being updated

/.desc: A devtmpfs that contains device nodes

childs.desc: Character device giving control access to the autofs daemon
Pointers to all block devices
Character devices allowing for communication with BUS subsystems
Pointers to all character devices
Character device for the system main console
Symbolic link to the core dump file
Character device for the CUSE subsystem
childs.note: Allows for the interaction of programs in the userspace with in-kernel emulation functions

childs.desc: Pointers to disk drives
Block device used by the device mapper
Direct Rendering Infrastructure devices
Character device for frame buffer interaction
Character device that always returns EOF on read and allows no writing
Character device for the FUSE subsystem
Pointers to IDE disk devices
Named from order of detection and partition number
Character device providing raw access to HIDs
Character device for the High Precision Event Timer
Bookkeeping for memory oversized page files
Character device for hardware random number generation
Pointer to the init daemon control interface
Character devices that handle the inputs from hardware into virtual events
Character device that provides access to the kernel log buffer
Character device to handle Kernel-based Virtual Machine subsystem
childs.note: Issues system ioctls to create and manage virtual machines

childs.desc: Pointer to the kernel log device
Block devices for loopback file mounting
Character device to dynamically control loop devices
Device mapper control interface for LVM related device nodes
childs.note: The logical volume manager maps block devices into higher-level virtual block devices

childs.desc: Character device for accessing physical memory
childs.note: Can be used to examine the system and the byte addresses are interpreted as memory addresses

childs.desc: Character device that always returns EOF on read and accepts and ignores all writes
Character device for non-volatile memory host controller interface specification disk devices
childs.note: The number represents the device controller

childs.desc: Block device for NVMe namespace partitions
childs.note: The first number represents the device controller, the second the namespace and the third the partition

childs.desc: Character device for non-volatile RAM access
Lock files indicate the usage of a particular device or file
childs.note: Lock files contain a PID as a 10-byte ASCII decimal number, followed by a newline character

/.desc: Secondary hierarchy for read-only shared resources
/.note: Contains the majority of multi-user utilities and applications

childs.desc: Binaries and executables for user commands that shall appear in the $PATH search path
C and C++ API header files of system libraries
Architecture-agnostic object libraries for packages, internal executables and other binaries
childs.note: Was originally reserved for shared essential libraries and kernel modules required to run binaries from /usr/bin and /usr/sbin

childs.desc: Architecture-specific 32-bit libraries
Architecture-specific 64-bit libraries
Binaries for system administration tools and daemons
childs.note: Not intended for direct execution by users or shell scripts

childs.desc: Tertiary hierarchy for local data specific to the host
Boot-essential and system administration binaries
Architecture-independent application data files
Kernel headers and applications source code

/.desc: Stores variable files that contain constant changing data

childs.desc: Log files from various programs
Temporary files stored for an unspecified duration, being preserved between reboots
